Description: Marl pottery jar of squat globular shape with rounded base, flat ledge-rim, and two cylindrical handles on the shoulders, pierced for suspension. The exterior is decorated with red-brown paint in a scale pattern covering the entire body and rim in imitation of stone.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D63a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair - cracked base, paint worn, part of rim missing.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
